message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the adaptation of polar bears to their environment. Polar bears have thick fur to help them survive in frigid places like the Arctic. The thick fur provides insulation and helps them retain body heat in extremely cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because it implies that polar bears intentionally grew thick fur to be hunted, which does not make sense and is not supported by scientific evidence. Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears do not live in deserts. Option (D) is incorrect because the rainforest is a warm and humid environment, where thick fur would not be beneficial for heat retention.

This question requires knowledge about the adaptations of polar bears to their environment. Polar bears have thick fur to help them survive in frigid places. The thick fur acts as insulation and helps to retain body heat, keeping them warm in the cold Arctic climate. Option (A) is incorrect because it is not the reason why polar bears have thick fur. Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears are not found in desert environments. Option (D) is incorrect because the thick fur would not be helpful in a rain forest climate.

Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears do not live in deserts. Option (D) is incorrect because a thick fur would not be helpful in a rainforest where it is hot and humid.
